contentLists.heading: Which methodologies and tools do you use for AngularJS Web project management?
contentLists.content:
We are using Agile project development methodology for meeting deadlines. Meanwhile, we also use cutting-edge project management tools to monitor and manage every phase of Angular Web development.

  • Jira

  • Slack

contentLists.heading: Why should I Choose Angular over other JavaScript Framework?
contentLists.content:
Here are some reasons on why should you prefer Angular over other frameworks:

  • Supported TypeScript by Google
  • Reusability, Simplified Unit-Testing, Ease of Maintenance
  • Simplified MVC Pattern
  • Easy to Use and Supported by a Large Community
  • Smoother Navigation for the Visitor
  • Component-based Architecture

contentLists.heading: Will you support me after the launch of the Angular Web Project?
contentLists.content: After completing the project, Our AngularJS development team is always eager to help clients if client need help.

contentLists.heading: How can I track the progress of my AngularJS Web Project?
contentLists.content: We interact regularly with the client and send an everyday work progress report to the client. We provide demos of every successful project development stage to clients. Meanwhile, clients get updates from project management tools like Jira, Trello, etc.

contentLists.heading: What is a Single Page Application (SPA) in AngularJS?
contentLists.content: Single Page Applications are web applications that load all of their single content on a single HTML page and only a part of the page instead of the entire page gets updated with every click of the mouse.

contentLists.heading: Is AngularJS SEO Friendly?
contentLists.content: Yes, AngularJS is SEO Friendly. Before 2014, Google was not crawling properly those pages that have java scripts. Google made an update in 2014 and announced that they are finally effectively crawling JavaScript. Thereafter, developers do not create any special layout for rendering HTML pages.
